covered: Valid Request: Default and many valid parameter combinations (offset/limit, accountWithBalance, accountWithBalanceAndCBA, audit) are exercised (e.g., TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC07).
Pagination: Offset/limit handling, boundaries and large-volume pagination are covered (TC02, TC19, TC21, TC27, TC48).
Query Parameters: Extensive coverage of valid, missing, malformed and extra parameters (TC14, TC25, TC29, TC38, TC39) and combined parameter interactions (TC07, TC26, TC42).
Empty & Edge States: Empty database, offset beyond data, partial datasets, limit greater than total, offset zero and other state variations are tested (TC08, TC09, TC30, TC46, TC47).

Error Handling: Client-side errors for invalid params (400s), auth failures (401), method not allowed (405), service unavailable (503), and timeouts are present (TC10-TC13, TC15-TC17, TC18, TC40, TC41).
Security: SQL injection and XSS attempts are tested and expected to return errors (TC23, TC24).
Boolean & Field Inclusion: Inclusion/omission of balance and CBA fields under different boolean flags is checked (TC03, TC04, TC26, TC42).
Audit Levels: FULL/MINIMAL/NONE behaviors and audit consistency with audit log are covered (TC05, TC06, TC33, TC45).
Concurrency & Performance: Concurrent requests and performance under large datasets and degraded load conditions are addressed (TC20, TC19, TC31).
Integration & Recovery: Dependency failures and recovery scenarios (account balance service, retry-after recovery) are present (TC32, TC36, TC37).
Accessibility & Error Messaging: JSON validity and descriptive error message requirements are included (TC34, TC35).
gaps: Rate Limiting / Throttling: No scenarios exercise rate limiting behavior or assert 429 Too Many Requests and Retry-After handling.
Caching / Conditional GET: No tests assert Cache-Control, ETag, If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since or 304 Not Modified behavior.

Response Headers / Content-Type: No explicit assertions that responses contain Content-Type: application/json (the spec requires produces: application/json) or other pagination headers (Link, X-Total-Count) if applicable.
403 Forbidden: No test for authorized-but-forbidden access (valid credentials but insufficient permissions) — only 401 unauthenticated is covered.
Full JSON Schema Validation: Tests check presence/absence of some fields but do not validate the full Account object against the API's #/definitions/Account (types, required fields, formats).
Server-side 5xx coverage: Limited coverage of generic 500 Internal Server Error and standardized error payloads for unexpected server failures.
Content Negotiation: No tests for Accept header handling or unsupported media types.
Rate-limit client behavior / retry/backoff: No tests for client retry semantics or server-provided Retry-After guidance.
recommendations: Add rate-limiting tests that send high-frequency requests to verify 429 responses, Retry-After headers, and graceful degradation under throttling.
Add caching/conditional GET tests: assert Cache-Control and ETag headers; test If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to verify 304 Not Modified behavior and correct caching semantics.
Explicitly assert response headers including Content-Type: application/json and any pagination-related headers (Link, X-Total-Count) produced by the API.
Introduce a 403 Forbidden scenario to validate behavior when credentials are valid but lack required permissions/roles.
Validate responses against the full Account JSON schema (#/definitions/Account) using JSON Schema assertions to ensure types, required fields and formats are correct for every success scenario.
Add tests that simulate generic server-side failures (500) to verify consistent error payloads and that monitoring/alerting hooks are exercised in QA/staging.
Add content negotiation tests (different Accept headers, unsupported media types) to ensure correct 406/415 or fallback behavior.
Add tests for client retry/backoff strategies and server Retry-After semantics in conjunction with rate-limiting and transient errors.
